oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cherokee girl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Cherokee girl outdoors wearing costume and holding up a rhododrendron blossom from the shrub next to her.

The Smoky Mountains are noted for both their Cherokee population and rhododrendrons. Although this clothing was described as "traditional costume" when the photograph was taken, it may also be from another tribe and staged for this photograph.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Girls; Flowers
